title: Interesting typographic places in Berlin?
content:
Hi there,

Next week I am visiting [Berlin](http://web.archive.org/web/20080830000810/http:/typophile.com/wiki/Berlin). Any advice about interesting typographic places to know, to visit or to take pictures of?

Thanks in advance.

 [‹ Specific Sans Recommendation](http://web.archive.org/web/20080830000810/http:/typophile.com/node/35128 "Go to previous forum topic") [News to Brighton your day ;-) ›](http://web.archive.org/web/20080830000810/http:/typophile.com/node/29556 "Go to next forum topic")
author: RamiroE

comments.content:
Everywhere! [Here are some of my pics.](http://web.archive.org/web/20080830000810/http:/flickr.com/photos/stewf/sets/72157594386592999/)

Stop by [FontShop Germany](http://web.archive.org/web/20080830000810/http:/www.fontshop.de/sukr.php3?ch=%2Ffontproductdetailc.php3%3Fns%3D1%26sns%3D0%26ns%3D1%26sns%3D0%26co%3D%26co2%3D%26id%3D6047147) for some free goodies.

Do not miss the [Bauhaus museum](http://web.archive.org/web/20080830000810/http:/www.bauhaus.de/shop/index.htm). Small but important.

Uncover some vintage printed stuff at a [flea market](http://web.archive.org/web/20080830000810/http:/www.berlinfo.com/Lifetime/Shopping/flea_markets/index.htm).

There’s a thread about the Hauptbahnhof, including some pictures  
 [http://typophile.com/node/21110](http://web.archive.org/web/20080830000810/http:/typophile.com/node/21110 "http://typophile.com/node/21110")

Underground stations signs are interesting and vary quite a bit.

See also  
 [http://dev.typophile.com/node/16903](http://web.archive.org/web/20080830000810/http:/dev.typophile.com/node/16903 "http://dev.typophile.com/node/16903")

And Herr Spiekermann has a studio there.  
 [http://dev.typophile.com/node/15651](http://web.archive.org/web/20080830000810/http:/dev.typophile.com/node/15651 "http://dev.typophile.com/node/15651")
Spiekermann left Meta many years ago. He now runs [SpiekermannPartners](http://web.archive.org/web/20080830000810/http:/www.spiekermannpartners.com/).

Thanks!  
And... I am going stay in Berlin for 2 days. If a local want to go for beers and typographic chats, just contact me.

Which days?  
Every 2 months the type geeks meet at the »Typo-Stammtisch« Berlin. Next week, on the 13th is another meeting.

Ralf
Stephen, thanks for correcting me. I should have remembered that.
You are welcome to the »Typo-Stammtisch« Berlin, Ramiro. Some people from FontShop, maybe Erik S. and other well known type designers will be there too.
Great! I am going to be in Berlin 12, 13 and 14 of july. And... how can I get to the »Typo-Stammtisch«?

The »Typo-Stammtisch« is held in [this restaurant](http://web.archive.org/web/20080830000810/http:/tinyurl.com/3a5tp2). You can have a look at the program [here](http://web.archive.org/web/20080830000810/http:/www.fontwerk.com/496/berliner-typostammtisch-0707-einladung).

Visit Tacheles Theatre

It’s a converted old department store that now houses Art Studios and a few bars. I was there in March, and in the backyard they had huge letters you can sit on.

You may also want to check out:

[http://www.smb.museum/smb/kalender/details.php?objID=13286&lang=en&typeI...](http://web.archive.org/web/20080830000810/http:/www.smb.museum/smb/kalender/details.php?objID=13286&lang=en&typeId=10&n=3 "http://www.smb.museum/smb/kalender/details.php?objID=13286&lang=en&typeId=10&n=3")

[http://www.smb.spk-berlin.de/smb/kalender/details.php?lang=en&objID=1405...](http://web.archive.org/web/20080830000810/http:/www.smb.spk-berlin.de/smb/kalender/details.php?lang=en&objID=14056&typeId=10 "http://www.smb.spk-berlin.de/smb/kalender/details.php?lang=en&objID=14056&typeId=10")

Ralf
There will be two lectures in German language, but after them I am sure you can speak with the most of us in English.
That’s the beauty of Berlin. All I know how to say in German is “I don’t speak German” and I got along fine ;-)

What time is the meeting? I can not find the time in the sites...  
Thanks.  
R.
Thank you very much for your visit. It was nice to got to know you. I hope you had fun and you understood our _nice_ language … ;)
